page.title: 03CAR FERRY TERMINAL
page.content:
Fishborne Car Ferry Terminal. The car ferry runs between Fishborne and Portsmouth, with services every hour. It is one of three car ferry routes operated in 1985 AD with British Ferries owning this route and one other. Bookings are made on a computer and summer reservations have to be made well in advance. Average cost for a family of four with their car is around Â£30 return depending on the size of the vehicle. Two new ferries were used in 1983 capable of taking around 100 cars and freight traffic, using a mezzanine (lifting) deck. Island residents are given a discount to travel to the mainland at the present time.
